articles.author: Gian Volpicelli, Wired UK
articles.title: The UK Is Trying to Stop Facebook's End-to-End Encryption
articles.description: The government's latest attack is aimed at discouraging the company from following through with its planned rollout across platforms.
articles.content: The UK is planning a new attack on end-to-end encryption, with the Home Office set to spearhead efforts designed to discourage Facebook from further rolling out the technology to its messaging apps.… [+3930 chars]

articles.author: Doug Johnson, Ars Technica
articles.title: The Dinosaur-Killing Asteroid Birthed Today's Rainforests
articles.description: Plant fossils from Columbia reveal the forests of the Cretaceous period were sparser and less humid than their modern-day counterparts.
articles.content: Colombias rainforest looked very different 66 million years ago. At present, the humid and biodiverse ecosystem is jam-packed with plants and is covered in a thick, light-blocking canopy of leaves an… [+4133 chars]

articles.author: Adrienne So
articles.title: I Didn’t Like the Bunch Cargo Bike. Too Bad My Kids Loved It
articles.description: When you’re reviewing an electric family bicycle, everyone gets to weigh in.
articles.content: Even with Bunch's new "anti-tip" technology, it took me about three blocks to adjust and stop running into the curb. This also meant that when my family was on board, I had to develop a type of Mad M… [+2630 chars]
